items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Mud Terrain
items.description: Mud Terrain tires offer drivers traction on off-road terrains such as mud, dirt, sand, gravel, and rock, and are commonly used on CUVs, SUVs, light trucks, and jeeps.

items.title: Do not show electric vehicle optimized

header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 235-75r16 drivers
Check out the sale price on this tire
Consistently rated as excellent by 235-75r16 drivers

content.body:
### Shop 235/75R16 Tire Size
235/75R16 tires are commonly found on larger vehicles from the 2010s. If you drive a 2000s or 2010-something Chevrolet Colorado, GMC Canyon, or VPG MV-1, then there’s a good chance you have 235/75R16 tires, and a new version of one of these vehicles might’ve rolled out of the factory with a set of [Firestone Destination A/T](https://simpletire.com/brands/firestone-tires/destination-a-t) or Goodyear Wrangler ST tires attached.

Popular Vehicles
2009-2012 Chevrolet Colorado
2009-2012 GMC Canyon
2011 VPG MV-1

All-season tires are built to perform in dry, wet, and light winter weather conditions, making them a popular choice for drivers. Check out the Michelin Defender LTX M/S, General Grabber HTS60, and [Nexen Roadian HTX RH5](https://simpletire.com/brands/nexen-tires/roadian-htx-rh5) if you’re looking for a set of 235/75R16 tires that are designed to perform year-round.

While most drivers stay on paved roads, some elect to hit the trails in their free time. All-terrain tires are a great option for the drive who goes on- and off-road, so take a look at the Firestone Destination A/T2, [Hankook Dynapro AT2 Xtreme (RF12)](https://simpletire.com.brands/hankook-tires/dynapro-at2-xtreme-rf12), or Eldorado Trailcutter AT2 if you’re looking for a set of 235/75R16 tires that can perform on any terrain.

While all-terrain tires can perform on any terrain, they might struggle in heavy ice and slush due to their rubber compound hardening in temperatures below 45 degrees Fahrenheit. Fortunately, winter tires are built to perform in these conditions so consider the [Nokian Nordman 7 SUV](https://simpletire.com/brands/nokian-tires/nordman-7-suv), Toyo Observe GSI-5, and Laufenn I FIT ICE LW71 if you want a dedicated set of 235/75R16 tires for your truck.

Whether you drive a Chevrolet Colorado, GMC Canyon, VPG MV-1 or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 235/75R16 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
